short_summary: Enhancement of national Parc Forillon site
description: Stage 1 - Forillon Park - Installation of signs at the approaches to the Route 132/Operational Center access road intersection.
full_summary:
**Tender Announcement**
**5P468-23-0100/A**

**Stage 1 - Forillon National Park**
**Installation of Signs at the Approaches to the Route 132/Operational Center Access Road Intersection**

**Background**

Parks Canada is seeking the services of a qualified contractor to install new signs at the approaches to the intersection of provincial highway 132 and the access road to the Forillon Park operational center, between Cap-aux-Os and Penouille.

**Requirements**

The contractor must perform and complete the work within five (5) weeks after contract award. The work includes:

* Installation of signs at the approaches to the intersection
* Clearing trees when necessary
* Providing and installing materials required for sign installation
* All surface repairs
* Road cleaning and maintenance during the work
* Traffic and sign maintenance

**Sign Features**

* Three (3) signs ranging in size from 3.2 m x 2.4 m to 5.1 m x 1.5 m
* Signs made up of extrusions and removable aluminum panelling
* Three (3) wooden posts measuring 200 mm x 200 mm, installed on concrete bases, for each sign

**Project Details**

The work will be carried out outside the boundaries of Forillon Park, along provincial highway 132, between Cap-aux-Os and Penouille. This is a busy area for visitors to the park, open from early June to mid-October.

**Bid Submission**

Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official. However, Parks Canada is not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba. All bids must be submitted through the Government of Canada tendering service at canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

**Schedule**

The bidder visit to the work site is recommended and will be held at the Forillon Park Operations Centre on July 5, 2023 at 10:00 AM Local time. Bidders are required to confirm attendance and provide the names of the individuals who will attend.

**Queries**

All technical and contractual queries must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority, Annik Piché, via email at annik.piche@pc.gc.ca. Queries must be received at least five (5) business days prior to the closing date to allow sufficient time for response.

**Important**

This is a two-step process, with Stage 1 evaluating the qualifications of interested suppliers, and Stage 2 inviting qualified suppliers to provide
